We know that our elections security is under attack. Today we voted on the #SAFEAct that will:
✅ modernize our election systems
✅ authorize new funds to improve election infrastructure 
✅ ensure the accuracy and integrity of our elections 
#ProtectOurDemocracy

1 day, 3 court decisions. Let's officially recognize June 26th as #LGBTQEqualityDay! Thanks to my friend @RepDelBene for introducing this resolution. We should take #PrideInProgress pic.twitter.com/W8RcmHCIjj
As a pediatrician, I will continue to demand accountability for how immigrant children are being treated. We can and must do better.
That is our immediate priority and is why we need to act quickly to authorize these additional funds. Children should not be pawns in the immigration discussion.

There is no question that we need comprehensive immigration reform. Yet at this moment, there are children at the border in unsafe conditions without access to adequate food, and the agency in charge is about to run out of money.

We are already gearing up for another fire season in Washington State. I am committed to working with our delegation to get more critical resources to our state to save lives and property.

Pleased to see that my fire equipment amendment with @RepRickLarsen will be considered for #FY20NDAA. Our amendment will ensure that excess DoD property that can be used to fight fires reaches states that have the greatest need and threat of wildfire.

I am wearing a rainbow ribbon to honor the 49 victims of the  #Pulse nightclub shooting. This #Pride Month, we must continue to fight against the hate that fueled this attack, and keep pushing for commonsense gun safety legislation.
